extendedInfo.description: A multi purpose utility to encrypt any text.It utilizes best practices encryption to ensure your data is safe from prying eyes.Encrypt your emails, messages, memos, notes, appointments, etc.If you are using Android 4.0 or later, please install EncryptIt - MkII.- Uses 256bit AES encryption- Uses salting to enhance the security of the seed/password to withstand brute force attacks and rainbow tables.- Uses salting to randomize the output to further enhance security.- Quick and efficient processing.Instructions:To encrypt:1. Type or paste text that is to be encrypted.2. Enter a seed (password), and hit the Encrypt button.The output is the scrambled text which can be save in an application or sent to someone.To decrypt:1. Paste the scrambled text to the application.2. Enter the seed (password) and hit the Decrypt button.

reviews.title: Simple to use
reviews.comment: Simple and easy to use and work well. Only not sure it can be easy to break or not.
reviews.author: Mile Cheung

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.comment: Has simple copy and paste functions for ease of use.. No special permissions required. Fast and efficent. I use this in cunjuction with kakao talk no problems!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great app
reviews.comment: Works good and easy to use too.  Would recommend it to ppl.
reviews.author: damien cammile

reviews.title: Great stuff
reviews.comment: I love the app, it does exactly what I want it to do.  The only glaring problem for me is that the seed field stays populated after you encrypt or decrypt a message.  I manually clear it every time, but it\'d be great if it did it by default or at least had an option to have it cleared.  That small change would make it a 5 star review.  Edit:  It does clear the seed when I hit the back button, but not when I hit the home button.  I\'m just suggesting that it clear when you hit the encrypt/decrypt button.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: clear and useful
reviews.comment: i use this to encrypt content for prior to generating QR code (2 dimensional barcodes).   Barcodes with encrypted sensitive info means i can save the barcode images anywhere in plain sight.  When i want the info I just scan back and copy via clipboard into \"Encrypt It\" to decode.  I use \"Encrypt It\" in parallel with \"QR Droid\" (barcode scanner/generator).  \"QR Droid\" already has the option to generate encrypted content .. but ... each time it encrypts you have to enter a key phrase twice.  This gets old very fast.  So using \"Encrypt It\" in parallel with\" \"QR Droid\" is much less keyboard heavy in the end (the keyphrase stays where it is for encode/decode until the app is done with).
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: OK
reviews.comment: I thought that the length of encyrpted messages were too long, practically. I loved ProCode by Appricot
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: CAN\'T DECRYPT BACK!
reviews.comment: It cannot decrypt back to original data after encryption.THAT IS WHY USELESS.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Very nice app
reviews.comment: Simple and sweet. If you\'re the only one with app its useless so get others to use it.  CM7 thunderbolt
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Simple and effective with a hidden flaw
reviews.comment: I cannot decrypt files sent to another Droid, using the same program and password; whether email or text.  So you can only use it for local encryption.  But if you backup data and your phone is damaged, you won\'t be able to recover the cipher text unless you repair the old phone, assuming what broke in the old phone isn\'t being used for the unique numbers it uses as a salt.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Excellent!!
reviews.comment: Does exactly what I want with a high level of encryption.
